converter.author: Intel Corporation

in_ports.description: DRange value of output when input is true.
in_ports.name: TRUE_VALUE

members.name: false_value

members.description: Float value of output when input is true.
members.name: true_value

out_ports.description: Float with value set on options or via value_set ports.
out_ports.name: OUT

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a boolean packet and convert it to empty.

in_ports.description: If received boolean is false generates a pulse.
in_ports.name: PULSE_IF_FALSE

converter.name: converter/boolean-to-empty

out_ports.description: Sends a pulse if boolean values received on each port match expected value.
out_ports.name: OUT

members.description: String sent when input is true.
members.name: true_value

out_ports.name: OUT

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a float packet and converts it to a string one. By its options, one is able to form a POSIX printf-like format string, besides entering literal prefix/suffix for that. The format string itself will be composed by flags, field width, precision and conversion specifiers given by options. The user is responsible for forming a valid string format at the end, but Soletta will prevent bad usage by not allowing '*', 'n', 'm' and such, while validing input.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the float value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

converter.name: converter/float-to-string

members.description: (Literal) prefix to compose the final string.
members.name: format_prefix

members.description: (Literal) suffix to compose the final string
members.name: format_suffix

members.description: Flags to compose the final format string (combination of '#', '0', '-', ' ' and '+' characters).
members.name: format_flags

members.description: Field width specification to compose the final format string (may be negative).
members.name: format_field_width

members.description: Precision specification to compose the final format string (negative values mean no precision specified on output format string).
members.name: format_precision

members.description: Conversion specification to compose the final format string (one of 'e', 'E', 'f', 'F', 'g', 'G', 'a' or 'A')
members.name: format_conversion_specifier

out_ports.description: Float converted to string with 6 digits after decimal-point character.
out_ports.name: OUT

converter.description: Receives an integer packet and converts it to a string one. The format string itself will be composed by flags, field width, precision and conversion specifiers given by options. The user is responsible for forming a valid string format at the end, but Soletta will prevent bad usage by not allowing '*', 'n', 'm' and such, while validing input.

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to boolean.

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to byte.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

converter.name: converter/string-to-byte

out_ports.description: Sends the byte-converted value on success. It does not send anything if a valid byte can't be parsed. The input value is expected to be on base 16 and may include '0x' prefix.
out_ports.name: OUT

out_ports.name: OUT

converter.description: Receives a string packet and convert it to int.

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a string packet and converts it to a blob (sub-type &SOL_BLOB_TYPE_DEFAULT) one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

converter.name: converter/string-to-blob

members.description: Include the terminating NULL byte (\0) in the blob size.
members.name: include_null_terminator

out_ports.description: Sends a blob packet with the contents of the string received in the port IN.
out_ports.name: OUT

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a blob packet and try to convert it to a string by scanning up to the first null byte (\0) or the end of the blob.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the blob value to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

converter.name: converter/blob-to-string

out_ports.description: Sends a string packet with the contents of the blob received in the port IN, up to the first null byte (\0) or the end of the blob.
out_ports.name: OUT

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a timestamp packet and converts it to a string one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the timestamp to be converted.

converter.name: converter/timestamp-to-string

members.description: Format string to be used in the conversion. The syntax is the same as strftime()'s.
members.name: format

out_ports.description: Packet with formatted date and time.
out_ports.name: OUT

converter.author: Intel Corporation
converter.description: Receives a string packet and converts it to a timestamp one.

in_ports.description: Where to receive the string to be converted.
in_ports.name: IN

converter.name: converter/string-to-timestamp

members.description: Format string to be used in the conversion. The syntax is the same as strftime()'s.
members.name: format

out_ports.description: Packet with timestamp converted from string received on port IN using format set on options.
out_ports.name: OUT
